intro: Micromeria forbesii var. altitudinum, commonly known as the highland micromeria, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its small, blue or violet flowers that bloom in summer. This variety is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and limited distribution.
